snippet: The nations controlling the International Atomic Energy Agency voted to end a decade-long effort to get Tehran to answer questions about its suspected nuclear weapons-related activities.
abstract: International Atomic Energy Agency’s board of governors votes unanimously to end its long-running, and largely unsuccessful, effort to get Iran to reveal information about its nuclear developments.

byline.contributor: Somini Sengupta contributed reporting from the United Nations.

lead_paragraph: The nations controlling the International Atomic Energy Agency voted to end a decade-long effort to get Tehran to answer questions about its suspected nuclear weapons-related activities.

headline.main: Vote at Atomic Agency Officially Ends Inquiry Into Iran’s Nuclear Past
headline.print_headline: Vote Ends Long Inquiry Into Iran’s Nuclear Past

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Arms Control and Limitation and Disarmament
